chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
l: nat
q: nat
p: nat

Goal:
is_gcd p q 1 -> is_gcd p (mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 l q) 1

Premises:
BinNat.N.mul = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.mul p q) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNat.N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
mscal : forall X : Type, (X -> X -> X) -> X -> nat -> X -> X
Module Init := Struct Definition Unconvertible : forall A : Type, A -> A -> Set. Definition unconvertible : forall (A : Type) (a b : A), Unconvertible A a b -> unit. End 
Module Nat := Struct Definition t : Set. Definition zero : nat. Definition one : nat. Definition two : nat. Definition succ : nat -> nat. Definition pred : nat -> nat. Definition add : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition double : nat -> nat. Definition mul : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition sub : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition eqb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition leb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition ltb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition compare : nat -> nat -> comparison. Definition max : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition min : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition even : nat -> bool. Definition odd : nat -> bool. Definition pow : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition tail_add : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition tail_addmul : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat. Definition tail_mul : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition of_uint_acc : Decimal.uint -> nat ->
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => r <d p /\ r <d q /\ (forall k : nat, k <d p -> k <d q -> k <d r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_rel_prime_mult : forall p q l : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> is_gcd p l 1 -> is_gcd p (q * l) 1
is_rel_prime_lcm : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> is_lcm p q (p * q)
is_gcd_lcm_mult : forall p q g l : nat, is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> p * q = g * l
is_gcd_mult_lcm : forall p q g l : nat, g <> 0 -> is_gcd p q g -> g * l = p * q -> is_lcm p q l
bezout_rel_prime : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q}}
power_mono_l : forall p q x : nat, 1 <= x -> p <= q -> mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 p x <= mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 q x
power_mono : forall p q x : nat, 1 <= x -> p <= q -> mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 p x <= mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 q x
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
prime_gcd : forall p q : nat, prime p -> is_gcd p q 1 \/ p <d q
is_rel_prime_div_r : forall p q k : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> p <d k * q -> p <d k
is_rel_prime_div : forall p q k : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> p <d q * k -> p <d k
gcd_spec : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q (gcd p q)
power_mult : forall p a b : nat, mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 (a * b) p = mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 a (mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 b p)
is_gcd_mult : forall p q r n : nat, is_gcd p (n * p + q) r < -> is_gcd p q r
power_mono_r : forall n p q : nat, p <= q -> mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 n p <= mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 n q
power_smono_l : forall p q x : nat, 2 <= x -> p < q -> mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 p x < mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 q x
bezout_nc : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> exists a b : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q
bezout_sc : forall p q a b m : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + m -> p <d m \/ q <d m -> is_gcd p q 1
is_lcm_minus : forall p q g l u : nat, p <= q -> p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q - p) (l - u * p)
is_lcm_plus : forall p q g l u : nat, p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q + p) (l + u * p)
is_lcm_mult : forall p q l k : nat, is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm (k * p) (k * q) (k * l)
is_gcd_rel_prime : forall p q g : nat, is_gcd p q g -> exists a b : nat, p = a * g /\ q = b * g /\ is_gcd a b 1
rel_prime_mult : forall a b c : nat, is_gcd a c 1 -> is_gcd b c 1 -> is_gcd (a * b) c 1
is_lcm_moduplus : forall k p q g l u : nat, p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q + k * p) (l + k * u * p)
is_lcm_modulus : forall k p q g l u : nat, k * p <= q -> p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q - k * p) (l - k * u * p)
is_gcd_1r : forall p : nat, is_gcd p 1 1
is_gcd_1l : forall p : nat, is_gcd 1 p 1
bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
bezout_generalized : forall p q : nat, {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l}}}}
divides_is_gcd : forall a b c : nat, a <d b -> is_gcd b c 1 -> is_gcd a c 1
